name: Intro
_source: # Since Malachy is loaded as red in the prior two maps, his team must be changed to fit the chapter scenario
speak;Simone;Brutus!{w}{clear}Look, there's a bounty out for the prince from Crucible.
speak;Simone;Malachy went to try and claim it.
speak;Simone;Prince Marcel and his entourage are coming up the Eastbank Road.
speak;Simone;Well, come on!{w}{clear}Aren't you going to do something about it?
speak;Brutus;I'll ready what men I can find.
speak;Simone;Only try not to kill him.{w}{clear}The governor of Wolfstock wants him brought in alive.
speak;Simone;Do what you think is right.{w}{clear}Good luck.
# Simone flies off. Brutus enters the cave. The camera pans to the off-screen Simone.
speak;Simone;'Can't make any guarantees' -{w} does he have any idea how much he's worth?
speak;Simone;Alright, it's not over yet.{w}{clear}If I swoop in and drop him and break his legs - {w}{clear}But I have to knock him out...
speak;Simone;You'll figure something out.{w}{clear}Keep talking to yourself like a lunatic.{w}{clear}That'll solve the problem.
speak;Elizabeth;Also, there's someone running up behind you.
speak;Marcel;Anthony.{w}{clear}Either you hit him too hard on the head,{w} or he's a really slow learner.
speak;Malachy;To prevent a great tragedy from befalling my friends!
speak;Malachy;Benson, the head of the local farming district,{w} and Brutus,{w} his right-hand man.{w}{clear}They'll be out for blood!

speak;Malachy;I know that Simone,{w} she's one to stir up trouble!{w}{clear}I bet you anything that she told either of them that I died -{w} a reasonable enough assumption to make! -{w} in order to rile them all up to get them to go after you!
speak;Malachy;Yes indeed, sir!{w}{clear}That Simone is ambitious!{w}{clear}She'll stop at nothing claim the reward!{w}{clear}She values the money more than her life!
speak;Anthony;Why would she go to such lengths?

speak;Malachy;You two don't understand,{w} being born rich,{w} but when you're poor,{w} you understand well,{w} all too well,{w} far too well,{w} what value money truly holds,{w} for money buys the most important thing of all...

speak;Malachy;To a poor man's perspective like mine,{w} for a sad old meaningless endlessly painful existence,{w} which my life experience embodies...{w}{clear}For the injuries inflicted by the razor's edge of life's struggle at the precipice,{w} money is the pain's only cure,{w} the only thing that keeps us tugging at the strings of Fate,{w} the only avenue of success that we can see.{w}{clear}Some are satisfied in chasing the dream,{w} and realizing it can never be achieved,{w} and settling down,{w} and starting a family,{w} and placing their hopes on their children,{w} to have them take care of them in their old age -{w} but Simone is not of that breed!{w}{clear}She's stubborn!{w}{clear}She never knows when to quit!{w}{clear}She'll either die rich or die young!{w}{clear}She's not one for compromising!{w}{clear}With her, there's no in-between!
speak;Marcel;(Hit him on the head again.)

speak;Malachy;I have seen the light,{w} your royal majesties!{w}{clear}When I awoke after being knocked out cold by the back end of that mighty axe,{w} I had an epiphany!{w}{clear}I realized that the life that I had led up until that point was worthless!{w}{clear}Meaningless!{w}{clear}A hedonistic rabbit-hole ending in an abysmal dead-end!{w}{clear}But I now see clearly!{w}{clear}My mission!{w}{clear}My purpose in life!{w}{clear}The light of existance!{w}{clear}I must accompany you in your holy mission!{w}{clear}Your crusade against the ignorant mass of darkness!{w}{clear}I realize now that I must be willing to lay down my life for a greater cause!{w}{clear}Your cause!{w}{clear}So,{w} therefore,{w} I shall put my axe at your service.{w}{clear}If I show even a hint of betrayal,{w} strike me down,{w} in the inglorious fashion I'll doubtless deserve!
speak;Marcel;You're not seriously considering letting him join?
speak;Anthony;I do feel bad for knocking him out.
speak;Anthony;If what he said about those farmers is true -

speak;Anthony;All the same,{w} based on what Elizabeth said earlier,{w} that pegasus driver has likely conjured up more friends,{w} and there's another band of brigands waiting up the road.{w}{clear}If we use Malachy,{w} we could avoid unnecessary bloodshed.
speak;Marcel;Not worth the risk.{w}{clear}He has every reason and every right to betray us at a moment's notice.
speak;Marcel;What, letting him join us for now,{w} and ditching him afterwards?
speak;Anthony;Malachy.{w}{clear}Us Crucibellians.{w}{clear}We believe in second chances.
speak;Anthony;So out of the kindness of our hearts.
speak;Anthony;We have decided to let you join our ranks.

speak;Malachy;Thank you!{w}{clear}Oh, my wonderful new friends,{w} thank you!{w}{clear}I promise to be of the utmost use to you in your journey!{w}{clear}I devote my entire life to be in service to your every need!
speak;Anthony;I'd expect nothing less from a man of your calibre.
speak;Benson;Y'know I don't think I'm still entirely convinced, like.
speak;Benson;Seems a bit sudden to be going to fight these guys like,{w}{clear}Without like even like knowing like for sure whether or not they did Malachy in.
speak;Brutus;Should've thought of that before you gathered up everyone around the village.

speak;Benson;Nah, I don't think like,{w} Simone's not telling the truth,{w} but I mean like I'm just looking at them all here,{w} like,{w} and it's like -{w} I've sat at the table for dinner with these lads like,{w} and like,{w} they haven't like,{w} got a violent bone in their body,{w} and I'm like,{w} like,{w} seeing them here now like,{w} and I'm just thinking like -{w} like -{w}{clear}It's a bit much.
speak;Benson;Nah like,{w} like -{w} I still like think like it's the right thing to do,{w} it's just like -{w} like -{w} there should be a better way to go about it.
speak;Brutus;Then this really would be pointless.
# hold-overs from chapter 0 - stops claude, claudia, the mother from being picked when they're not there.
